text: My heart pounded so hard it felt like it might tear through my chest as I stared at the ritual circle.
The chanting wrapped around my thoughts like an invisible net, suffocating me under its weight.
“Lucia, we… we have to go,” I whispered, my voice trembling, barely sounding like my own.
“What?” She turned, eyes wide in disbelief. “What did you just say?”
I didn’t look back. I just ran—toward the exit as fast as I could.
🎲 [Will Check: Failed] Your fear overwhelms your reason. All you can hear is your heartbeat.
The explosion of the ritual echoed behind me. Blue light devoured the shadows inch by inch, as if countless unseen eyes were watching.
Lucia shouted, “The mentor’s still inside! What are you doing, you coward?!”
A violent shockwave cut her words short. The walls cracked, iron shards scattering through the air.
I was thrown down the stairs, my head slamming into the floor. Everything went dark.
When I opened my eyes again, the world was no longer the same.
Half of the underground chamber had collapsed. The air reeked of ash and burnt stone. Lucia and Alicia were nowhere to be seen.
Pain tore through my chest—each breath felt like swallowing knives.
I staggered to my feet. Beneath me lay a broken stone pillar, faint runes still glowing across its surface.
The altar at the center was empty now. Only a wisp of blue mist hovered in the air—Alicia’s shattered amulet.
I stumbled closer and reached out my hand.
The moment my fingers brushed it, a low murmur echoed in my ears:
“...The Cycle is not over... the memory shall be reforged...”
The voice came from within me. I staggered back as the blue light flared, the fragments scattering into the air like dust.
Then—silence.
I stood there in a daze. Only ashes and cold wind surrounded me.
The sound of collapsing stone faded away, like the last notes of a funeral song.
I reached the exit. As I pushed the door open, snow was falling outside.
A gust of wind slipped through the cracks, snuffing out the last of the fire behind me.
I looked down—and saw the brass die lying quietly on the ground, face-down.
I picked it up. It rolled once in my palm and stopped—showing a zero.
I froze. That die was never supposed to have a zero.
【Bad Ending: The Collapsing Cycle】
The snow kept falling. No one answered.
